description: Lord Tennyson called Vergil the "wielder of the stateliest measure ever moulded by the
lips of man."  Students encounter that stately measure when they translate selections
from Vergil's three major poems (Eclogues, Georgics, Aeneid). Through
discussion and readings, students also explore the development of Latin epic and Vergil's
literature, art, and music. Depending on the instructor, students engage in at least one
significant writing project, e.g., on poetic interpretation or literary translation. Offered
